pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were making large mouthfuls. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.3.1: “‘I will not make a mouthful that’s too large,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.4: One should not make mouthfuls that are too large.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes a large mouthful, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.12: if it is any kind of fruit;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.13: if it is a non-bean curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.16: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.17: The ninth training rule is finished.
